title: Publications
description: We publish papers, books, and edited volumes that contribute not only to Holocaust and Genocide Studies but also to a wide array of fields such as computational history, digital humanities, and engineering.

items.title: Virtual Holocaust Memory, a Book Review
items.teaserText: In recent decades, the memory of the Holocaust has found its place in the virtual world. By presenting the recently published monograph by Matthew Boswell and Antony Rowland, this article explores this new place.

items.title: Crying like a Baby : Multimodal Survival Analysis of Holocaust Testimonies
items.teaserText: Crying like a baby is a phrase we often hear in survivors' testimonies. But how often do women and men cry in their testimonies? Most importantly, which memories cause them to cry? This paper searches for answers.
